com.saic.uicds.core.em.endpoint

Class IAPServiceEndpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.saic.uicds.core.em.endpoint.IAPServiceEndpoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.saic.uicds.core.infrastructure.util.ServiceNamespaces

    @Endpoint
public class IAPServiceEndpoint
extends Object
implements com.saic.uicds.core.infrastructure.util.ServiceNamespaces
    The Incident Action Plan (IAP) Service allows UICDS compatible clients to manage an IAP and the related ICS form work products that are associated with a UICDS incident. It includes services to:
    • create, update, or retrieve an IAP
    • create, update, or retrieve ICS Forms
    • attach any work product to a particular IAP
    • set and get the approved version of the IAP work product for an incident

    The Incident Action Plan work product is defined as the following data structure:

    Work products associated to an IAP as Components can be any work product the client wishes to be part of the Incident Action Plan for example maps, image files, ICS, etc. Most of the time the associated work product will be ICS Forms that are represented by XML documents defined as part of this service. Components of the IAP may also have a UICDS task associated with them that represents a task to complete the work product. Each component also has a status that can be a string value. Currently the IAP Service defines XML schemas for the following ICS forms:

    • ICS 201
    • ICS 202
    • ICS 203
    • ICS 204
    • ICS 205
    • ICS 206
    • ICS 207
    • ICS 209
    • ICS 210
    • ICS 211

    The IAP Service manages work products of type "IAP" and "ICSForm".

    Author:
    Andre Bonner
    See Also:
    Appendix: IAPService.wsdl, Appendix: IAPService.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm201.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm202.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm203.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm204.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm205.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm206.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm207.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm209.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm210.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm211.xsd, Appendix: ICSForm.xsd, Appendix: ICSFormCommon.xsd, Appendix: UICDSCommon.xsd
